value.message: logger.error used for shutdown error, but shutdown is not a critical failure.
value.suggestion: Use logger.warn or logger.info for shutdown errors unless it is a critical failure.

value.message: logger.error used for batch event emission failure, but not all emission failures are critical.
value.suggestion: Use logger.warn for recoverable batch emission failures.

value.message: logger.error used for event handler error, but not all handler errors are critical.
value.suggestion: Use logger.warn for recoverable event handler errors.

value.message: logger.error used for event history retrieval error, but not all retrieval errors are critical.
value.suggestion: Use logger.warn for recoverable event history retrieval errors.

value.message: logger.error used for middleware error, but not all middleware errors are critical.
value.suggestion: Use logger.warn for recoverable middleware errors.

value.message: Access control error handling may rethrow errors without denying access, risking insecure fail-open behavior.
value.suggestion: Ensure that when access control or event handler errors occur, access is denied by default and no permissions are granted. Do not rethrow errors without explicit deny logic.
